Posts.Content: Hi any members of group?  Is anyone doing their Radiotherapy at The Royal Marsden Fulham/Chelsea?  Cheers Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have had my planning meeting today and have a start date of May 10 so i guess i will be joining the May group in a few days.  I found the planing session strangely emotional. The Senior Radiographer was very professional and formal and said not to use any creams other than my normal skin care routine. This made me laugh as I don't usually have a skin care routine for my left breast.  There have been a lot of threads on here about creams and I printed off the R1 and R2 info but GP and Radiographer seemed dismissive.  I have got some Aloe Vera Gel from Holland and Barrett. Anything else anyone would suggest?   The feeling of lying in the machine did make me feel emotional but the tatoos made me cry.  The radiographer just kept going - as was probably wise - to get it over and done with.  But I want to have a good sob at that point. Having had a great week and feeling much more like myself I started to feel vulnerable again. Not a good feeling. I am sure by the end of it all I will have got used to it all. Cheers to the next phase and the end is in sight! Chin up. Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Jill Great message. Can you share recipe for healthy cookies? Our family have gone low sugar and I fell off the wagon this week! Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you. I shall use all those web links Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thanks Sam I am getting well supported. Sounds like you have managed it all very well. I have a window of feeling better so I am going to go in part time then review when radio starts as I have a three hour round trip to appointments. Will do what I can.  Thanks again. Good luck with your final treatment. Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Dear Penny L Thanks for your posts. They are honest and helpful and will help us all when we hit that spot. Not sure we can or should protect ourselves from the thoughts though, they are part of our job processing all we have been through.  Great idea to spend the month actively healing yourself with walks and yoga and time... at the start I found great comfort in healthy baking and looking forward to getting back to that. Cheers to recovery time. We could all be stronger, kinder and more gentle as a result.  Best wishes Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Sam, I am interested in how you are managing work while on Radiotherapy. Are you a teacher? Did you have Chemo too? I am a teacher. Return to work phased this week part time. Radiotherapy starts in four weeks as having s break post chemo.  Thanks Katiepie
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny I am writing in sympathy. It’s grim. I am 49 and was having similar problems and prior to diagnosis of BC. I was about to start taking medication but did not start as it was too much mind stuff for me. I think triggered by three babies and then being perimenopausal! Chemo has now confirmed full menopause.  I am focusing on exercise and diet and have started estragen pessaries which are great for v thinning and dryness. Maybe helping a bit with leaking too. I am in wait and see at the moment.  It is bloody depressing to feel like your privates giving up on you.  I think things are a bit better though so I feel hopeful. Katiepie
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer & now a bladder prolapse!

Posts.Content: Ahhhhhhhh!  Blinking Nora! Wishing you a swift exit and peace at home!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Dear Karebear One week into my last chemo and I found it really hard too. Maybe the wistfulness of it all being over - but not yet-  is just too overwhelming. I hope you transition to start recovery asap. I can relate to your tears.  Let's breath and hold on tight until we start to feel a bit better.  Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LiziX Good luck for tomorrow. I use the Braun battery operated in your ear thermometer. Very similar to the one they use in the hospital.  Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hello Leolady I completed my last paclitaxol of 12 yesterday.  My experience has been ok. I am HRT 2+.. I have had herceptin too and will be for 1 year.  I have tended to have SE on days 3-5 and first week there were almost none.  My hair loss has been very slow. And with tactical cutting I have managed with hats but go for a wig fitting tomorrow. I want to try part time work in my 4-6 week break before radio therapy starts.  To all those at the end of chemo Yesterday was weired as I wanted to feel more elated but I still have genetics results to wait for and a CAT scan for a lump in my abdomen which mean I can't celebrate.   I have been off alcohol almost through out. I don't drink much so been easy but thinking I could have the odd glass now. Anyone else managed a drink? Anyone using BC to stop altogether? Finally I feel so tired I really want to get fit. I am not sporty. Anyone else got a fitness plan!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Dear fellow travellers, I am posting today on day 4 after my final dose of 12 paclitaxol. New side effects this week which are occupying my mind as we are due to go on a family break tomorrow for 4 days with our three kids and I am feeling grim. I realise that no more chemo does not mean I will be SE free... and this is the effects of the recent dose any way. My nails feel bruised... is this the start of something more sinister or will it pass? this is new to me. I feel really bloated and uncomfortable in my abdomen with some mild back ache - saw the doctor yesterday who just seemed to say watch and wait. Tingling in my toes has got worse but is still bearable - just constant. My teeth are aching My mouth feels a bit slimy - is this the start of oral thrush?  Can anyone recommend over the counter medication before I see doctor again on Monday 16th. I have piles :( Has anyone else come to the end of their Paclitaxol and had similar experience? The good thing about Paclitaxol seems to be that SE can be less extreme - the bad thing seems to be that there is very little time to recover between doses. I may need to post this in more general chat as perhaps there is no one else in this group with this experience yet. Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Blues Jk Hi, I can see this is a really difficult decision to make. It is so unfair that you have to make it at all. I really wouldn't want to advise you one way or the other as I think you have explained really well all the many things you have to consider. What I can say is that when I was faced with a big decision I had to make about my treatment the most helpful thing was to talk it through with my breast care nurse at the hospital. She was so kind and gave me the time to talk to her more than once, face to face. It meant in the end I followed my instinct without no regrets. She was objective and knowledgeable and never rushed me. Good luck. You are doing the right thing.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I mean enjoyed school run Not chemo. Lol. I would rather have not done that part!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Karebear Hi, I know what you mean. There are so many confusing emotions on this journey. I think you recognise it but try to move on.  For your new friend it sounds like you want to keep contact. How about you text her regularly and meet up for coffee when she is having a good day. Take it slowly and don't rush in. Let the friendship grow over time. You can't take on all her troubles too but you can be there for a chat or advice.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I am so pleased for you. Well done. You must rest now. One thing a day.  Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Yes. I had 4 while on paclitaxol and now having them on their own. No sugnificant side effects to talk of. Nurse said most common is flue like symptoms. I am a bit achey but I was anyway! Feeling much more like myself at the moment. Lingering side effects post chemo are finger nails very sore and bruised. Aching feet. Aluminium mouth. Tired blurry eyes in mornings and at night. Hair not growing back yet (only been three weeks).  But really feeling much more energy to I am cheerful!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Top tip is loads of water day before and morning off. I had a Picc and really great.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LiziX Thinking of you. You must miss the kids... How old are they?  If you have the energy write them a few notes that can get left in funny or silly places for them.  I did this for my son when he was drifting... he quietly loved it and he is 13 so very cynical.  Here is a silly picture for no good reason than you might be lying in bed starring at the walls...I hope it makes you smile.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Dear Ruby Rose I am so sorry to hear about your Mum. Losing a parent, no matter what their age, is a profound loss. You are right to tell the nurses on the unit. Do you have a BCN? Please ask for all the help you can get. When I lost my Dad I was stuck with deep sadness for a very long time. I had to say to my husband - I can't do this by myself, I need your help. - It worked best when I was very specific with what I needed - the trouble is knowing what help you need. Try to write your feelings and needs down somewhere private. You can bin them later if you need.  You have a right to be sad and emotional - that is what makes us human.  We will all be thinking of you... keep on using the forum.  Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Message to all you superwomen. You are all awesome... remember this. Sleep well and if the sleep doesn't come, get up and do something creative.  Hugs Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Gosh Dormouse I am keeping my fingers crossed for you. Such a long stay. I really hope you get home to sleep in your own bed and recover.  Good luck Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LiziX On the school run issue I have three kids. Mostly I was fine on school run and I enjoyed the time with my daughter chatting. I told the school and on occasions I dropped late or collected early. I also told two key mum's and asked them to tell others. I got mobile numbers of anyone offering help. Over 12 weeks treatments I heeded help a few times and texted a group message to ask for  help like pick up and keep for a bit. I got one family who turned out to be goldust - mum and dad. 90 % of time I was fine and enjoyed it. Good luck.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose Well done for getting through day one. Keep a practical diary of each day, I wish I had. Just list symptoms or reactions. You can use it to talk to the nurses if you do feel worried. Remember everyone has their own journey and you may have more good days than you expected. You have nailed day one which is a huge hurdle.  Good plan to start on your Mums eulogy...keep taking one day at a time.  You can do this.  Katiepie
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
